post.body: and a 17" MBP with new batteries. iWork 09 Cloud Edition...
what you think they'll announce ?
Guess I'll roll up an AMI with R in it, along with the default libs I need. Thanks. Glad to hear it's not a wacky idea.
I still look at it as an evolution of time sharing -> ASP -> SaaS -> Cloud. Label change only in most cases.
Waiting for connecting flight in Singapore, on way back to London - been tiring Oz trip, but good.
the tedium of waiting at LHR will be followed by 23 hours of tedium on-board. Hope that in-flight ents have decent movies
On way to Australia from http://piurl.com/oRp : current location - long journey
good to see @thinkovation and @monkchips in JFK - world put to rights again !
finished the last forma session of the day here at the IBM Software event. time for informal networking before the transit to JFK
airbus video - nice but a bit cheesy
why no mention of IGF as an ISV enabler here?
Should there be a common template for presenting Framework case studies. Covering all the main entities in a fixed order, with fixed content
IBM Framework concept - sensible but needs work to make it sound consistent. different execs seem to have different nuances to the concept
almost none of the examples used at the IBM event are US - but almost all of the analysts come from the US. Hmm..
Interesting that Jim Corgel will also talk about academia partnerships
IBM confirming my assertion of the last 12+ months that "geography matters". The world is not flat after all
IBM SWG has 14,700 in US.Canada, 4,200 in EU, 7400 in AP
growth markets assignments are a good thing to have in an IBM career
IBM are deploying lots of people into growth markets
growth markets need deeper consultative skills in the sales - how do do this without an imperialism element?
also interesting than less than a third of the analysts have spent any time in the "growth markets". How many have passports?
interesting that people don't understand what frameworks are at the IBM event
Silly comment that the debate on separation of IT and utilities management is silly. Less than ideal knowedge of staff, skills and safety
utilities session not really drawing on the huge heritage of the PwC utilities busines.... shame, really.
Tweets for Today: 16:38 @markng I still look at it as an evolution of time sharing -> ASP -> SaaS -> Cl.. http://tinyurl.com/8zsc4a
but Oracle (http://linkbee.com/N03) still being criticised for lack of variable consumption model in the Cloud. Wonder whether LJE is right?
Needs to be a wider range of AMI's avavalable and an easier model for extending these. Remote RPM invocation model? RPM->AMI -> S3/AMI.
Would like an EC2 EMI (http://linkbee.com/N00) to run compute intensive models/forecasting R models (http://linkbee.com/N02). Make it myself
Example at CNet (http://linkbee.com/N0Y) shows lots of sites are relying on cloud-only architecture. Amazon EC2 came to EMEA recently too.
2009 should be the year of Cloud/SaaS and pay-per-use (PPU). MSFT home PC PPU model patent application (http://linkbee.com/N0V) 21/11/07
